questions.question: You are given the array [7, 2, 13, 5, 6, 11, 3, '4', 9, 1].  What is the index of '4', given the array begins at index 0?

explanations.a: '4' is not at index 8. Remember that the array begins at index 0, not 1
explanations.c: '4' is not at index 3. Remember that the array index begins from the left side of the array
explanations.d: '4' is not at index 4. Remember that the value of an element has no correlation to position

questions.question: If an array of N elements is completely traversed for each element in the array, what is the time complexity of the algorithm?

explanations.b: Incorrect. The algorithm traverses the same amount of elements every iteration, so the algorithm is not logarithmic
explanations.c: Incorrect. The algorithm traverses N elements N times.
explanations.d: Correct, this is a quadratic time complexity algorithm.

questions.question: Given the array [7, 4, 8, 5, 6],  Which option is correctly sorted in ascending order?

answers.d: Depends on which data structure is used

explanations.a: Incorrect. The array must be sorted in an ascending(Increasing) order
explanations.b: Incorrect. The sorted array should have the same number of elements as the given array.
explanations.d: Incorrect. While different data structures sort the data differently, their end results are identical

questions.question: Which is false about an array?

answers.b: Searching for an element is O(N)
